result.execSummary:
One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joshua Franklin Michels is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA:  Alexis S. Mckinley DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson DF:  Joshua Franklin Michels appeared from jail.  Includes 14CF260, 14CF380, 14CF381, 14CF481,14CF482,14CF490,14CF525, 14CF439, 14CM194, 14CM291, 14TR2825, 14TR2826, 14TR2827, 14TR2970, 14TR4419, 14TR4420 and 14TR5662. Case called at 8:09. ADA McKinley updates the court and makes joint recommendations.  Victim's rights have been complied with. Court questions 14CF260 amended information adding the count 5- possession with intent to deliver  psilocin/psilocybin <100g. 961.41 (am)(g)1 class G felony. There is no objection to the added count 5. ADA McKinley signs the amended information. Court allows the filing of the second information. DE understands the restitution of $19 in 14CF439 has been paid through the jail kiosk. 

Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct. 1 and NC to Ct. 5 in 14CF260 and G to Ct.1 in 14CF380. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 and 5 in 14CF260 and Ct. 1 in 14CF380. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2, 3, 4 in 14CF260. Ct. 2, 3, 4 in 14CF380. Court reads in and dismisses Ct. 1 in 14CF525 for restitution only and outright dismisses Ct. 2, 3, 4,5 and 6 in 14CF525. Court dismisses 14CF381, 14CF439, 14CF481, 14CF482, 14CF490, 14CM194 and 14CM291. 14TR2825, 14TR2826, 14TR2827, 14TR2970, 14TR4419, 14TR4420 and 14TR5662 are all dismissed. Court orders a PSI to be completed by April 30,2015.  Bail revoked. Any money should be maintained by the clerk pending sentencing. Atty's are to calculate credit and have dates available.  
DE remanded into St. Croix County Jail.  
Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 10:00 am.
From Atty Harrelson requesting to have Judge Needham hear all cases for the plea hearing. OK per EJL on 02-23-15. OK per EFV on 02-24-15. hml

ADA: Alexis S. Mckinley, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Joshua Franklin Michels appeared from jail.  Court recalled at 4:24 p.m.  Includes case 14CF439, 14CF482 & 14CF490 (arraignment) & 14CF525 & 14TR5662.  Court questions the DE on 14CF482.  DE has reviewed the Information.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Speedy trial is waived.   Court questions the DE on 14CF439.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Speedy trial is waived.  Court questions the DE on 14CF490.  Court informs DE of charges, possible penalties and rights. Defendant understands.  DE pleads Not Guilty on all counts.  Speedy trial is waived.  14TR5662 will follow.  ADA Mckinley recites the proposed agreement to the DE.  Bail is continued.  Attorneys will schedule a hearing after speaking with Branch 3 about resolution and files in that Branch.  Court adjourned at 4:35 p.m. lw

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Webb, ADA: Alexis Mckinley, DF ATTY: Jeremiah James Harrelson, DF: Joshua Franklin Michels appeared from jail.  Court called at Includes case 14CF439, 14CF482 & 14CF490 (Set for arraignment) & 14CF525 (Preliminary Hearing) & 14TR5662.   ADA Mckinley advises the court the DE will be waiving his right to a preliminary hearing.  Court questions the DE regarding waiving his right to a preliminary hearing on 14CF525. Court finds that DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives right to a preliminary hearing.  Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and that the DE probably committed and binds the DE over for trial.  DE is bond over to stand trial.  Bond remains.  Court adjourned at 4:23 p.m. lw
and Motion for Review of Bail Bond. Filed by Atty Harrelson. km

ADDRESS INFO for Joshua Franklin Michels

Prior: 315 E Walnut St, River Falls, WI 54022 
per Defendant's bond. eif
Preliminary hearing on February 11, 2015 at 04:00 pm.

Includes 15CF525, 14CF490, 14CF481 and 14CF482

  It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Chauntel S.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

  Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

CO: EJL, RPR: Val Deiss, CLERK: E. Ferrill, ADA:   Kenneth N. Sortedahl,  DF ATTY:  John A. Kucinski,  DF:  Joshua Franklin Michels appeared from jail. Court confirms address.   Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading. Prelim demanded.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 11, 2015 at 04:00 pm.
